title: Stormont Live - BBC News
summary: representatives of the ni arts council are briefing the culture committee on their savings delivery plans from 10am .
ni screen , which provides information , funding and resources for filming in northern ireland , is also briefing the mlas .
today 's meeting of the justice committee at 2pm has a briefing from officials about a consultation into proposed reform of the laws on abortion .
the committee also has sessions of police discipline , and legal services .

documents.title: goodbye
text: alastair ross winds up the justice committee 's meeting for this week .
join us on monday morning for a plenary session of the full assembly .

documents.title: 'fluffy and nice '
text: edwin poots tells the committee that hmp hydebank , a young offenders ' centre near belfast , has been renamed hydebank college .
`` it 's all very fluffy and nice , '' he says .
alban maginness says the concept of a secure college comes from the united states .

documents.title: redeployment
text: sinn fein 's raymond mccartney asks about the proposed sanctions given that there would be no financial penalties or reduction in pay .
ms montgomery says that , alongside the usual sanctions applying to any sphere of employment , there could be `` redeployment to another post within the service '' .

documents.title: 'burdensome '
text: lorraine montgomery says the police service of northern ireland 's ( psni ) disciplinary procedures have been described as `` overly bureaucratic '' and `` unnecessarily burdensome and costly ''
she outlines some of the proposed reforms .

documents.title: police discipline
text: departmental officials lorraine montgomery and lesley mccombe are briefing members on the reform of police discipline and unsatisfactory performance procedures .

documents.title: legal services
text: department of justice officials are briefing the mlas on statutory registration scheme for all providers of publicly-funded legal services in northern ireland

documents.title: '99.3 % opposed '
text: the dup 's edwin poots says 99.3 % of people who responded to the consultation were opposed to any change in legislation .
he says the department has `` chosen to ignore the outcome of the consultation '' .

documents.title: catholic ethos
text: the sdlp 's alban maginness asks how the catholic ethos of the mater hospital in north belfast could be protected when there was no proposal for a conscientious objection clause for institutions .
`` it would n't be , '' ms pearson replies .

documents.title: policy proposal
text: sean lynch of sinn fein asks why the minister is not planning to legislate before the next assembly election in 2016 .
ms pearson says it would take time `` to develop a workable policy proposal '' .

documents.title: conscientious objection
text: stewart dickson says he believes the minister , an alliance colleague , has handles the issue `` incredibly sensitively '' .
he asks about a `` conscientious objection '' clause for medical staff .
doj official amanda patterson says the proposal is that the clause would be `` only for the people who have a direct involvement in the actual procedure for termination '' .

documents.title: 'broadest view '
text: mr ross says that from the results of the consultation it appears that 99 % of the respondents were opposed to a change in the law .
ms pearson says the minister took the broadest view possible based on `` the totality of what was said to him '' .

documents.title: 'many , varied responses '
text: karen pearson says the responses were many and varied .

she says the minister , david ford is proposing a change to the law allowing abortion in the case where there has been a diagnosis of foetal abnormality likely to result in death `` and the continuance of the pregnancy would have a detrimental effect on the health and wellbeing of the woman '' .

documents.title: abortion law
text: justice department officials karen pearson and amanda patterson are briefing the committee on the results of a consultation on abortion legislation .
the consultation concerns abortion in cases of lethal foetal abnormality and sexual crime .

documents.title: in the chair
text: the dup 's alastair ross is chairing the meeting .

documents.title: we 're back
text: business resumes in room 30 at parliament buildings , stormont .
this afternoon we have a meeting of the justice committee .
this promises to be an interesting session with abortion law reform and police discipline among the items on the agenda .

documents.title: committee in closed session
text: the culture committee has moved into closed session .
after a quick turnaround , we 'll be bringing you coverage of the justice committee , so join us again from 2pm .

documents.title: reservoirs bill
text: mlas discuss the disposal of publically-owned reservoirs , ahead of a proposed reservoirs bill , which the clerk , peter hall , says `` currently sits with 250 suggested amendments .
it 's going to be quite an epic discussion , i think '' .

documents.title: 'stepping back ? '
text: the sdlp 's karen mckevitt asks if they are `` stepping back '' from strategies to help young people develop skills such as coding .

mr williams says the funding situation is affecting some initiatives , but ni screen is still able to support modern apprenticeships , including 40-50 , 18 month long placements within the film industry .

documents.title: 'working magic ? '
text: basil mccrea asks how ni screen `` worked this bit of magic '' to secure £ 1.8m funding from the culture department , rather than a predicted £ 1m .
`` as much as you can say we pushed it up from £ 1m to £ 1.8m , it still fell from three to £ 1.8m , '' says mr williams .
mr mccrea points out that the arts council mobilised a lot of public support against cuts , but still had an 11 % budget reduction .

documents.title: 'reasonably content '
text: despite have `` some casualties '' as a result of cuts , mr williams says ni screen are `` reasonably content '' with its budget allocation .
sinn fein 's cathal o hoisin talks about the importance of local film festivals .

documents.title: after school clubs saved
text: mr williams says that around christmas 2014 , ni screen feared its funding from the culture department would be slashed from £ 3m a year to £ 1m .

but , he says , culture minister caral ni chuilin was able to provide £ 1.8m , which `` we have calculated is sufficient to maintain the educational eco-system '' including after school film clubs , which reach over 260 schools across northern ireland , and the foyle and belfast film festivals .

documents.title: ni screen briefing
text: richard williams and linda martin from northern ireland screen are now telling the committee about their savings delivery plans .

mr williams starts his briefing by listing the successes of the local film and television and gaming industries , including the recording of of game of thrones and the award winning short film boogaloo and graham .

documents.title: 'step up '
text: basil mccrea of ni21 says he thinks the arts council ni needs to `` step up '' when presenting the argument that this year 's 11 % cut to the arts will send `` shockwaves '' through the sector .
noirin mckinney responds by saying `` i think we did run a very robust advocacy campaign '' .
mr mccrea replies `` i noted the response , the impact of it was zero .
so , not the best campaign in terms out outcome '' .

documents.title: 'not enough being done '
text: ulster unionist leslie cree says he is convinced `` not enough is being done '' to attract eu funds to support the arts .
`` there 's a lot of money there and we 're not getting our share of it .
if you wait until something 's announced , you 're very much on the back foot .
you need to be there from the start influencing policy '' .

documents.title: website costs £ 100k
text: sdlp mla karen mckevitt asks about the planned closure of the

ms mckinney says the website cost around £ 100k a year to run and while it is `` an excellent resource '' , at a time when the arts council wants to protect creative organisations , it has become unsustainable .

documents.title: 'punching under their weight ? '
text: cathal o hoisin of sinn fein asks whether arts groups in northern ireland were `` punching under their weight '' in terms of accessing european funding .

shauna mcneilly says the number of recent applications suggests `` one of the things we could do better is to creative partnerships and work collaboratively and perhaps generate further applications '' .
she says between 2007 and 2013 , `` just eight organisations '' had drawn down eu funding .

`` when you consider the number of cultural organisation in northern ireland , i think we could probably try to develop applications to creative europe and that 's what the desk is there to do , '' says ms mcneilly .

documents.title: voluntary exit
text: lorraine mcdowell from the arts council says savings on staff pay have been achieved through a recruitment freeze .
the council is also considering `` flexible retirement '' options and a voluntary exit scheme , whether as part of the wider civil service programme , or one specific to the organisation .

documents.title: creative europe
text: shauna mcneilly talks about her role as eu engagement officer for the creative europe programme .
the €1.46bn scheme is running until 2020 and ms mcneilly aims to increase the amount of funding coming to northern ireland 's arts sector .

documents.title: venues 'hit hard '
text: ms mckinney says the arts council tried to establish which organisations `` can best sustain a cut '' - for example venues , such as the mac arts centre and the lyric theatre in belfast , and the millennium forum in londonderry , which have the option of raising funds through ticketing have been 'hit hard ' while other volunteer groups offering free classes were better protected .

documents.title: arts council briefing
text: noirin mckinney , shauna mcneilly and lorraine mcdowell from the arts council are telling the committee about the ways the organisation has delivered savings .
ms mckinney says they are making cuts while `` trying to retain a balance of provision '' across the arts and throughout northern ireland .
avoiding duplication of services and encouraging merging and co-operation between groups were among the methods they used to reduce costs .

documents.title: casement concerns
text: the committee also discusses casement park gaa stadium in west belfast .
they agree to request that members of the technical group in charge of assessing the stadium development appear to answer questions .
cathal o'hoisin of sinn fein says it is important to ask about capacity issues , ingress and egress at the stadium as well as car parking .

documents.title: windsor park
text: mlas discuss health and safety concerns around
the west stand of the ground has been closed off because of possible subsidence , throwing into doubt the stadium 's hosting of northern ireland football team 's forthcoming euro 2016 qualifiers .
`` the safety of those spectators going to the matches has to be paramount , '' says the dup 's william humphreys .
basil mccrea of ni21 says he would like departmental officials to appear in the committee to answer questions .

documents.title: mccausland in the chair
text: the dup 's nelson mccausland is chairing this morning 's meeting .

documents.title: good morning
text: thanks for joining us for coverage of stormont 's culture committee .
the first evidence session will be a briefing from the arts council on plans to deliver savings and how this will affect services .
